intro: Actephila ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf actephila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
